thread.title: Forest Grove police arrest man accused of stealing purse, trying to bite an officer
thread.title_full: Forest Grove police arrest man accused of stealing purse, trying to bite an officer | OregonLive.com

author: Casey Parks | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Forest Grove police arrest man accused of stealing purse, trying to bite an officer
text:
James Oneill, 23, was booked into the Washington County Jail on charges of first-degree burglary, second-degree theft, unlawful entry to a motor vehicle and attempted assault on a police officer. Casey Parks | The Oregonian/OregonLive
Forest Grove police have arrested a man accused of stealing a purse and attempting to bite an office.
Officers said a woman called 911 around 10:20 Saturday night to report a man was trying to break into her home. As officers rushed to the scene, the man made it inside, took the purse and fled, she said.
Others had reported a man matching the description hiding near Pacific University and breaking into a vehicle there. Officials from the Forest Grove Police Department, Washington County Sheriff's and Pacific University campus public safety began looking for the man.
They found James Oneill, 23, about 20 minutes later. Authorities said Oneill attempted to bite one officer while they took him into custody. He was booked into the Washington County Jail on charges of first-degree burglary, second-degree theft, unlawful entry to a motor vehicle and attempted assault on a police officer. He will be arraigned Monday.
-- Casey Parks
